intro: Androsiphonia adenostegia, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers range in color from white to pink. Androsiphonia adenostegia plays an important ecological role in its native environment, providing nectar for pollinators and shelter for small organisms.
